lines.text: [last lines]
[Vickie receives a phone call from "Bruce Wayne" that is actually a recording]
Vickie, I'm sorry, I can't keep our date. I need a vacation; I'm leaving town for a week. You understand, don't you?
Well, of course, Bruce. You must be completely worn out.
[to Batman]
You know, I thought I had discovered your identity, but I just found out I was wrong.
Really? Who did you think I was?
Bruce Wayne. Wasn't that silly?
Yes, wasn't it?
What's botherin' you?
Harrison's safety. The Wizard must have heard that broadcast - perhaps he even inspired it.
Harrison's decision really must have knocked the props out from under his blackmail scheme.
Yeah, that's what I'm afraid of. What's to prevent the Wizard from attacking Harrison on his way here?
Batman and Robin might.
[first lines]

Crime, striking our city night and day, is on the increase. Our undermanned police force is helpless to cope with the situation, but they have an ally - Batman - who with the faithful Robin, wages unending war against all criminals!
Run the usual test for invisible ink. I'll change and go entertain Vicki.
You better be careful. I think she's beginning to get wise that Batman and Bruce Wayne are the same.
Well, if she gets too close, we know how to throw her off the trail.
You can't go in there!
Well, I'm Vicki Vale of Picture magazine.
Vicki Vale, eh? Well, I'm Officer Murphy of the Patrol Bureau. You still can't go in there!
Untie me please!
Haven't got time; you'll be all right. Don't go away!
Will you do me a favor?
Certainly.
I'm going to have dinner with Bruce Wayne, will you join us?
That's very nice of you.
Then you'll come?
Of course!
